title: Functional site updates: contact/WhatsApp number, new service, and CTA/navigation verification

requirements.summary: Update centralized site configuration with the provided WhatsApp number, wa.me link (with prefilled message), and a phone value usable for tel: links.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/config/site.ts contains the WhatsApp number as "+91 9182768591" (or equivalent formatting) and the WhatsApp link uses https://wa.me/919182768591 with a prefilled message query string
A phone contact value exists in site configuration that can be used to render a tel: link (e.g., tel:+919182768591)

file_operations.description: Update siteConfig.whatsapp.number to "+91 9182768591" and siteConfig.whatsapp.link to "https://wa.me/919182768591" with a prefilled message query string; add a centralized phone contact value (e.g., siteConfig.contact.phoneDisplay and siteConfig.contact.phoneTel) so UI can reliably render click-to-call tel: links.

requirements.summary: Show the phone number as a click-to-call option in key contact areas (Footer and Contact page) and ensure WhatsApp CTAs consistently use the updated config link in a new tab.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer shows a phone entry that links to tel:+919182768591 and is keyboard accessible
Contact page 'Other Ways to Reach Us' includes the phone number as a tel: link in addition to email and WhatsApp
WhatsApp button and any WhatsApp links on the site open the updated wa.me link in a new tab

file_operations.description: Add a visible phone entry in the Footer 'Get in Touch' list using the centralized phone tel: value from siteConfig; ensure it uses an anchor tag with appropriate focus styles (consistent with existing keyboard-accessible links) and keep WhatsApp link sourced from siteConfig.whatsapp.link with target="_blank".

In 'Other Ways to Reach Us', add a phone contact row that links to the centralized tel: value from siteConfig (in addition to existing email and WhatsApp). Ensure the WhatsApp link continues to use siteConfig.whatsapp.link with target="_blank" and rel="noopener noreferrer".

Confirm the WhatsApp CTA always uses siteConfig.whatsapp.link and opens in a new tab (target="_blank" with rel="noopener noreferrer"); keep the component as the single source for WhatsApp CTA behavior across pages.

requirements.summary: Add a new service "Complete Business Automation System" to the Services page list with conversion-focused copy and the same structure as existing services.
acceptanceCriteria: Services page renders an additional ServiceCard titled "Complete Business Automation System"
The new service includes non-empty 'what it is', 'why it matters', and 'business impact' text consistent with the existing tone and format

file_operations.description: Append a new services array item with title "Complete Business Automation System" and non-empty whatItIs/whyItMatters/businessImpact copy matching existing service tone and ServiceCard props structure.

requirements.summary: Verify end-to-end functionality: navigation routes and primary CTAs work, and the contact form submits for guest users with clear success/error feedback (no Internet Identity login required).
acceptanceCriteria: Header navigation links route correctly to Home, Services, About, Pricing, and Contact on both desktop and mobile menus
All primary CTA buttons that point to internal pages (e.g., "/contact", "/pricing") navigate without errors
Contact form submission works for logged-out/guest users and displays the existing success state on success and error state on failure
Backend stores submitted contact form entries via submitContactForm without authorization requirements (no regression to backend/main.mo public contact form behavior)

file_operations.description: Audit and adjust (if needed) desktop and mobile nav Link targets so they route correctly to Home (/), Services (/services), About (/about), Pricing (/pricing), and Contact (/contact); ensure mobile menu closes on navigation as it currently does.

Audit internal CTA Link usage to ensure that provided href values (e.g., "/contact", "/pricing") are treated as internal routes and navigate without errors; keep Link-based navigation consistent across all CTA blocks.

Audit and fix (if needed) the plan CTA navigation behavior so primary plan actions route to the intended internal pages (e.g., contact/pricing) without errors, aligning with REQ-4 internal CTA routing expectations.

Improve guest submission robustness by ensuring the contact form mutation gracefully handles actor-not-ready timing (e.g., expose an "isActorReady"/"canSubmit" state and/or provide a clearer error for initialization) while continuing to call submitContactForm and preserving success/error states.

Wire in any new readiness state from useContactForm (e.g., disable submit until backend actor is ready and show a clear message if not ready) to ensure logged-out/guest users can submit successfully without requiring Internet Identity login; preserve the existing success and error feedback UI behavior.
Confirm the router includes routes for Home, Services, About, Pricing, and Contact and that paths match all navigation/CTA Link targets; adjust route definitions only if a mismatch is found.
